For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned accountability assessment was performed.
Question Text: Was drug accountability performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not study product accountability was performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented on a CRF page level on a visit-by-visit basis. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the type of study product for which accountability was assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the type of study product dispensed/returned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it can be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. See SDTMIG DA domain examples for populating DACAT and DASCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the name of the study product for which accountability was assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the study productt dispensed/returned (e.g., Bottle A, Bottle B).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate grouping values, but different from those for DACAT). See SDTMIG DA domain examples for populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the study product was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the accountability assessment was performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the exact date the study treatment was (dispensed or returned), using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier such as study product label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).
Question Text: What was the study product label identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record treatment label identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to tie together a block of related records and to link dispensed product to returned product. The packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional identifier variables.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding (e.g., dispensed, returned).
Question Text: What was the study product accountability being assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the study product accountability assessment if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable DATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in the CDASH field DATEST. The SDTMIG variables DATESTCD and DATEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

CDASHIG Variable Label: DA Assessment Result in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the drug accountability assessment as originally dispensed or returned (e.g., actual amount).
Question Text: What is the result of the accountability assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the actual amount of treatment dispensed or returned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: General prompt to establish whether any death details are available.
Question Text: Were any death detail assessments collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the death details are known. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
Implementation Notes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date death detail assessments were collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
Question Text: What was the subject's date of death?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of death.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH Model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name for death details.
Question Text: What was the death detail assessment test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the death detail assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable DDTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in DDTEST. Both DDTESTCD and DDTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the death detail assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the death detail response.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What is the category of the death detail results?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the death detail results category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
Question Text: Who provided the death detail assessment information?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using theis format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the inclusion and exclusion assessments were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Inclusion/Exclusion CRF using the date (IEDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Indication whether the subject met all the eligibility requirements for this study at the time the subject was enrolled.
Question Text: Were all eligibility criteria met?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record Yes if all eligibility criteria were met at the time the subject was enrolled. Record No if subject did not meet all criteria at the time the subject was enrolled.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
Implementation Notes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of collection of the inclusion/exclusion criteria represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the eligibility criteria assessment was performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record complete date when the eligibility assessment was performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping category to denote whether the protocol entry criterion being assessed is inclusion criteria or exclusion criteria.
Question Text: What was the category of the criterion?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Check the appropriate box to indicate whether the criterion exception was related to the subject's inclusion or exclusion.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: These categories have been defined in SDTM and have controlled terminology that must be used. Only records for criteria that are not met appear in the IE SDTMIG domain. IECAT must be populated. This criterion category may be collected on the CRF in a tick/checkbox format or it may be included as part of the criterion identification and mapped when the SDTM submission datasets are created.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the IECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the criterion?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. This can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize the criterion as a major or minor exception.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unique identifier associated with the criterion that was the exception.
Question Text: What was the identifier of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If the subject was not eligible, record the identifying code for each criterion that was an exception.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This field is required to appear on the CRF, but may be null if there are no exceptions to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. The CRF should allow multiple exceptions to be recorded. See SDTMIG for assumptions regarding protocol versioning. Sponsors may provide a list of inclusion/exclusion criteria and the unique identifying codes to the site. The list provided should be versioned/updated when the protocol changes and the criteria are changed. Sponsors should use sponsor-developed controlled terminology for IETESTCD.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception.
Question Text: What was the description of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the description of the criterion, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable IETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in IETEST. The SDTMIG variables IETESTCD and IETEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors could automatically populated the text in EDC systems when the criterion identifier is populated by the investigator. This can be verified by the PI to ensure the right exception identifier was selected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of which inclusion criterion was not met or exclusion criterion was met.
Question Text: What is the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This is only a data collection field when a complete list of inclusion and exclusion criteria are included on the CRF with Yes/No response options. If the sponsor collects only the criteria that are not fulfilled, then, when an inclusion criterion is not met, IEORRES is mapped to "N" and when an exclusion criterion is met, IEORRES is mapped to "Y".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column .
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the musculoskeletal system findings assessments were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the MK CRF using the Collection Date (MKDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
Question Text: Was a musculoskeletal system findings [measurement/examination] collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not a musculoskeletal system findings assessment was done.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable MKSTAT. If the CDASH variable MKPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable MKSTAT is "NOT DONE". If MKPERF= "Y", MKSTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., MKCAT and MKSCAT, MKTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable MKTESTCD would be populated with MKALL and an appropriate test name (MKTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the musculoskeletal system findings assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the musculoskeletal system findings assessment was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable MKDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the musculoskeletal system findings assessments were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the MK CRF using the Collection Date (MKDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time the musculoskeletal system findings assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time the musculoskeletal system findings [measurement/examination] was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable MKDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A single collection time (e.g., MKTIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [MKTESTCD]_MKTIM.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What is the planned time point for this musculoskeletal system findings [measurement/examination] collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for respiratory assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors MKTPTREF (text description) and MKRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables MKTPTNUM, MKELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What is the musculoskeletal system findings test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the musculoskeletal system findings test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable MKTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MKTEST using the Controlled Terminology List MUSCTSCD. The SDTMIG variables MKTESTCD and MKTEST are required in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The test name will usually be preprinted on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. MKTEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What is the category of the musculoskeletal system findings [measurement/examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the musculoskeletal system findings category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. MKSCAT can only be used if there is a MKCAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the MKCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the musculoskeletal system findings [measurement/examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the musculoskeletal system findings subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. MKSCAT can only be used if there is a MKCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MKCAT.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MK Test Result in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the musculoskeletal system findings test result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate the overall assessment for [MKTEST].
Mapping Instructions:
This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation; for example: 
 
 1. Where MKRES is to used collect normal/abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., absent/present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field MKDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field MKRES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables MKORRES and MKSTRESC with the value of the CDASH field MKRES. If the CDASH field MKRES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable MKORRES with the CDASH field MKDESC. If the reported findings in MKDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable MKSTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and MKMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in MKDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable MKSTRESC is populated with the CDASH MKDESC field. The SDTM variable MKNRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. 
 2. Where MKRES is used to collect standardized (e.g., codelist) values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field MKRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field MKRES field is mapped to the SDTM variable MKSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field MKRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable MKORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH field MKRES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable MKORRES and must be transformed. For example, \n MKRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected.MKORRES is collected using "Normal", "Abnormal", and a description of the abnormality is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Text description of musculoskeletal system findings.
Question Text: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record all abnormal findings for the musculoskeletal system in the space provided.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable MKORRES. If MKRES="Normal", populate MKORRES with the value of MKRES. If MKRES="Abnormal", populate MKORRES with the value of MKDESC.
Implementation Notes: MKRES and MKDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See Section 8.3.1, General CDASH Assumptions for Findings Domains.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
Question Text: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide more detail for the "Other" result.
Mapping Instructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field MKRES is mapped to the SDTM variable MKSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field MKRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable MKORRES.
Implementation Notes: In cases where MKRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field MKRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
Question Text: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record where the measurement or examination result fell with respect to the reference range.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Reference ranges may be defined by MKSTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
Question Text: Indicate if the [MKTEST] was not [answered/done/performed].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the musculoskeletal system measurement or examination was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for MKREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
Implementation Notes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH MKPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the measurement or examination was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MK System Findings Reason Not Done
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
Question Text: Was the was the reason that the musculoskeletal system (measurement/examination/[MKTEST]) was not [collected / answered / done]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide the reason the measurement or examination was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When MKREASND is used, MKSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MK System Findings Position of Subject
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Question Text: What was the position of the subject during the [measurement/ examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the position of subject at time of measurement or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for musculoskeletal measurement or examination, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [MKTESTCD]_MKPOS may be created for each MKTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Location used for the measurement.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the [measurement/ examination] was [collected/done]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/ examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the musculoskeletal test or measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the [measurement/ examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the musculoskeletal test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MK Method of Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method (used for the [measurement/ examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used for the musculoskeletal test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MKEVAL.
Question Text: What is the identifier of the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
Question Text: Was this record considered to be the accepted evaluation?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Use where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
Question Text: What was the repetition number within the time point for this [measurement/ examination]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The repetition number of the examination/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column .
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable NVDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the NV measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the NV CRF using the Nervous System Assessments (NVDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
Question Text: Was a neurology assessment performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not a neurology assessment was done.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable NVSTAT. If the CDASH variable NVPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable NVSTAT is "NOT DONE". If NVPERF= "Y", NVSTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., NVCAT and NVSCAT, NVTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable NVTESTCD would be populated with NVALL and an appropriate test name (NVTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the neurology measurement was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the neurology measurement was taken?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable NVDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the NV measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the NV CRF using the Date of Collection (NVDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the neurology measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable NVDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What is the planned time point for this neurology assessment measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for neurology assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors NVTPTREF (text description) and NVRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables NVTPTNUM, NVELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What is the neurology test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the neurology test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable NVTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in NVTEST using the Controlled Terminology List NVTESTCD. The SDTMIG variables NVTESTCD and NVTEST are required in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The test name will usually be preprinted on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. NVTEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the neurology assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the neurology assessment category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the NVCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the neurology assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the neurology assessment subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. NVSCAT can only be used if there is a NVCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of NVCAT.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Neurology Test Result in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the neurology test result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate the overall assessment for [NVTEST].
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation; for example: \n 1. Where NVRES is to used collect Normal, Abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., Absent/Present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field NVDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field NVRES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables NVORRES and NVSTRESC with the value of the CDASH field NVRES. If the CDASH field NVRES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable NVORRES with the CDASH field NVDESC. If the reported findings in NVDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable NVSTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and NVMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in NVDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable NVSTRESC is populated with the CDASH NVDESC field. The SDTM variable NVNRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. \n 2. Where NVRES is used to collect standardized values (e.g. a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field NVRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field NVRES field is mapped to the SDTM variable NVSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field NVRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable NVORRES. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH field NVRES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable NVORRES and must be transformed. For example,NVRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected.NVORRES is collected using "Normal", "Abnormal", and a description of the abnormality is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Text description of neurology test findings.
Question Text: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record all abnormal findings for the neurology test in the space provided.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable NVORRES. If NVRES="Normal", populate NVORRES with the value of NVRES. If NVRES="Abnormal", populate NVORRES with the value of NVDESC.
Implementation Notes: NVRES and NVDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See CDASH General finding Assumptions

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
Question Text: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide more detail for the "Other" result.
Mapping Instructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field NVRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable NVSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field NVRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable NVORRES.
Implementation Notes: In cases where NVRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field NVRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".

CDASHIG Variable Label: NV Ref Range Lower Limit- Original Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in NVORRES.
Question Text: What was the lower limit of the reference range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the neurology test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: NVORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable NVSTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

CDASHIG Variable Label: NV Ref Range Upper Limit- Original Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in NVORRES.
Question Text: What was the upper limit of the reference range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the neurology test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: NVORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable NVSTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
Question Text: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record where the test result fell with respect to the reference range.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Reference ranges may be defined by NVORNRLO, NVORNRHI, NVSTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
Question Text: Indicate if the [NVTEST] was not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the neurology assessment or measurement was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for NVREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
Implementation Notes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH NVPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
Question Text: Was the was the reason that the neurology (assessment/[NVTEST]) was not [collected / answered / done / assessed / evaluated]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When NVREASND is used, NVSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Question Text: What was the position of the subject during the assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the position of subject at time of test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for neurology test, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [NVTESTCD]_NVPOS may be created for each NVTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Location used for the measurement.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the neurology test or measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the neurology test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the neurology test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used for the neurology test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in NVEVAL.
Question Text: What is the identifier of the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
Question Text: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was this result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether neurology test results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation, as required by the protocol.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable OEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the OE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the OE CRF using the Ophthalmic Examinations (OEDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used for the identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen (as described in the protocol), for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
Question Text: Which eye/eyes?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record which [eye was/eyes were] the focus of the finding or observation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This variable is expected to be populated for ophthalmic studies. It is used as the key identifying variable to denote the focus (which eye or eyes) of the test finding or observation.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
Question Text: Was an ophthalmic examination performed?
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable OESTAT. If the CDASH variable OEPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable OESTAT is "NOT DONE". If OEPERF= "Y", OESTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., OECAT and OESCAT, OETPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable OETESTCD would be populated with OEALL and an appropriate test name (OETEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.3 Section 4.5.1.2.
Implementation Notes: This field is used to capture a response regarding whether a planned measurement, test, or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the ophthalmic examination measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date of the ophthalmic examination measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable OEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of the measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time the ophthalmic examination measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis

CDASHIG Variable Label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
Question Text: What was the name of the ophthalmic [measurement/test/examination]?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable OETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in OETEST. The SDTMIG variables OETESTCD and OETEST are required in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The test name will usually be preprinted on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included as the column heading. OETEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.
