Question Text: What was the date of the [examination/procedure] used for [tumor/lesion identification]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the scan/image/physical exam date used to identify the tumor/lesion using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to identified the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
Question Text: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
Question Text: What was the identifier of the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.
Question Text: What was the [tumor/lesion] (link) identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and the this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor/lesion.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The identifier for the procedure used to identify the tumor.
Question Text: What was the identifier for the procedure used to identify this [tumor/lesion] ?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the procedure [ID or Line Number] used to evaluate the tumor/lesion.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the PR domain.
Implementation Notes: Intent is to establish a link between the TU identified and the procedure undergone to identify this tumor/lesion. TUPRNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the TU dataset and records in the PR dataset. See SDTMIG for information on RELREC.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used to [evaluate/identify] the [tumor/lesion]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used to evaluate/identify the tumor/lesion.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors may collect the method used to identify the tumor/lesions via a codelist which includes the most commonly known or generally recognized terms. The values will represent the method generically, not the product of the method (e.g., photograph). A sponsor may customize or restrict the list of values per response criteria or protocol needs. At a minimum, the primary method of identification should be entered and is expected to be consistent throughout the study; recording secondary methods is at the discretion of the sponsor.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier, such as image ID number (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound identifier).
Question Text: What was the procedure [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the internal or external identifier assigned to the procedure/method used to identify the tumor/lesion.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This variable may be used to collect a reference/accession number associated with the method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Sponsors may use the CDASH variable TUPRNO as an identifier for a procedure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What was the [tumor/lesion] Identification test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the TU test, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable TUTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TUTEST. The SDTMIG variables TUTESTCD and TUTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the tumor identification (e.g., classification or type of tumor).
Question Text: What is the [type/classification] of [tumor/lesion] as defined by the criteria being employed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the TU classification. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable TESTCD (e.g., TUMERGE, TUSPLIT, TUMIDENT) or TESTCD_TUORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the TU test code. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location of the [tumor/lesion] (identified)?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location. A location detail text field (TULOCDTL) is conditional for entry (i.e., can be left blank) and allows the study site to specify the lesion in its own terms or can be used to distinguish tumors within the same location if other location qualifiers are not specific enough.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
Question Text: What was the laterality of the anatomical location?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the body within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A detailed description of the location of the identified tumor/lesion.
Question Text: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the [tumor/lesion] so that it can be distinguished from other [tumor/lesion] in the same anatomical location?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Describe additional detail on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPTU dataset as the value of SUPPTU.QVAL where SUPPTU.QNAM="TULOCDTL" and SUPPTU.QLABEL= "TU Identification Location Detail".
Implementation Notes: Use if TULOC and TULAT and/or TUDIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified tumors. TULOCDTL is not meant to replace TULOC, TULAT, and/or TUDIR or serve as the free-text description field for TULOC (e.g., Location, Other).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
Question Text: What was the name of the vendor used?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VISDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the UR measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the UR CRF using the Urinary Assessments (URDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
Question Text: Was a urinary assessment performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not a urinary assessment was done.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable URSTAT. If the CDASH variable URPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable URSTAT is "NOT DONE". If URPERF= "Y", URSTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., URCAT and URSCAT, URTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable URTESTCD would be populated with URALL and an appropriate test name (URTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the -STAT variable in SDTM as " NOT DONE".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the urinary measurement was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the urinary measurement was taken?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable URDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the UR measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the UR CRF using the Date of Collection (URDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the urinary system measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable URDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

CDASHIG Variable Label: UR Assessment Planned Time Point Name
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What is the planned time point for this urinary assessment measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for urinary assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTM time-point anchors URTPTREF (text description) and URRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables URTPTNUM, URELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What is the urinary test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the urinary test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable URTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in URTEST using the Controlled Terminology List URNSTSCD. The SDTMIG variables URTESTCD and URTEST are required in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The test name will usually be preprinted on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading. URTEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What is the category of the urinary test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the urinary assessment category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. URSCAT can only be used if there is a URCAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the URCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the urinary assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the urinary assessment subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. URSCAT can only be used if there is a URCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of URCAT.

CDASHIG Variable Label: UR Test Result in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the urinary test result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: Was the result (normal/abnormal/absent/present/ [sponsored defined response])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate the overall assessment for [URTEST].
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation, for example: \n 1. Where URRES is used to collect normal/abnormal or similar type classifications (e.g., absent/present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field URDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field URRES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables URORRES and URSTRESC with the value of the CDASH field URRES. If the CDASH field URRES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable URORRES with the CDASH field URDESC. If the reported findings in URDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable URSTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and URMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in URDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable URSTRESC is populated with the CDASH URDESC field. \n 2. Where URRES is used to collect standardized values (e.g. a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field URRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field URRES field is mapped to the SDTM variable URSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field URRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable URORRES. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH field URRES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable URORRES and must be transformed. For example,URRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected.URORRES is collected using "Normal", "Abnormal", and a description of the abnormality is collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Text description of urinary test findings.
Question Text: What was the description of the (abnormality/observed finding/[Sponsor-defined])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record all abnormal findings for the urinary test in the space provided.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable URORRES. If URRES="Normal", populate URORRES with the value of URRES. If URRES="Abnormal", populate URORRES with the value of URDESC.
Implementation Notes: URRES and URDESC are used when a question is asked to collect the finding result, with a follow-up question for a description of the finding. See Section 8.3.1, General CDASH Assumptions for Findings Domains.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
Question Text: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide more detail for the "Other" result.
Mapping Instructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field URRES is mapped to the SDTM variable URSTRESC and the value in the CDASH field URRESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable URORRES.
Implementation Notes: In cases where URRES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field URRESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
Question Text: Indicate if the [URTEST] was not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the urinary assessment or measurement was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF"; if populated from other sources such as free text or sponsor-defined listing for URREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
Implementation Notes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH URPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
Question Text: Was the was the reason that the urinary (assessment/[URTEST]) was not [collected / answered / done / assessed / evaluated]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When URREASND is used, URSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Location used for the measurement.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the urinary test or measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the urinary test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the urinary test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used for the urinary test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in UREVAL.
Question Text: What is the identifier of the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
Question Text: Was this record considered to be the accepted evaluation?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Use where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
Question Text: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was this result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether urinary test results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
Implementation Notes: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation, as required by the protocol.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What is the subject identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
Question Text: Were vital signs performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if vital signs were collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name VSTEST provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date of the vital signs measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the vital signs measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for vital signs, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the vital signs?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the vital signs category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
Question Text: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What is the vital sign test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the vital sign test if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in VSTEST. Both VSTESTCD and VSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC CT for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
Question Text: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the vital sign measurement was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: A Not Done checkbox, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be 1 checkbox for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual VS tests to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

CDASHIG Variable Label: VS Result or Finding in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the vital sign result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This should be preprinted on the CRF (or enterable from a picklist) with the associated test when possible, rather than collected as free-text.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.
Question Text: Was the result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of vital signs measurements.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Question Text: What was the position of the subject during the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g., SITTING).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs, as specified in the protocol, were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the finding about measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Findings About Date (FADAT) field.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Findings About Object of the Observation
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.
Question Text: [Sponsored-defined phrase]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: [Protocol-specific]
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The FAOBJ will usually be preprinted or hidden, not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether data was collected for the finding topic.
Question Text: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the there are findings. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
Implementation Notes: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field, it provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, or observations were done.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.
Question Text: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the [FATESTs] was/were collected. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This field is used to capture a response to whether a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date when the findings about assessment was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date the findings about assessment was performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable FADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the FA measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the FA CRF using the Date of Collection (FADAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the findings about assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
Question Text: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the FATEST if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the detail of the [FATEST], if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: It is recommended that the test detail name be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the FA category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the FACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the FA subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. FASCAT can only be used if there is an FACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
Question Text: In what position was the subject during the [measurement/ test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection]?; What was the position of the subject (during the [measurement/test/examination/specimen collection/sample collection])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the position of the subject during the FA test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

CDASHIG Variable Label: FA Result or Finding in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [result/amount/(subject's) characteristic] (of the [measurement/test/examination/question/assessment])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the FATEST result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What [is/was] the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the unit of measure associated with the test, or record if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

CDASHIG Variable Label: FA Normal Range Lower Limit- Orig Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.
Question Text: What [is/was] the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the FA test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: --ORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

CDASHIG Variable Label: FA Normal Range Upper Limit- Orig Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in FAORRES.
Question Text: What [is/was] the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the FA test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: --ORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable --STNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment, or could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
Question Text: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record where the test results were categorized within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Reference ranges may be defined by FAORNRLO, FAORNRHI, FASTNRC or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: This variable is used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
Question Text: Was the [--TEST ] not [completed/answered/done/assessed/evaluated ]?; Indicate if the([--TEST] was) not [answered/assessed/done/evaluated/performed].
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the [FATEST] measurement was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. If collected, the Origin (a column in the Define-XML) ="CRF", if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for FAREASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
Implementation Notes: Used only when the response value is collected as NOT DONE or NULL in lieu of or in addition to the CDASH FAPERF field. Typically a checkbox which indicates the test was NOT DONE. This field can be useful when multiple questions are asked to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An explanation of why data are not available.
Question Text: Was the [is/was] the reason that the [Findings topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide the reason why an FA test was not collected.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused, etc.) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
Question Text: What [is/was] the specimen type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What [is/was] the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the condition of the specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.
Question Text: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the [measurement/test/examination]) or What [is/was] the anatomical location where the [measurement/specimen] was taken/collected)?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Laterality of Location of Finding About
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the [FATEST] measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e.,arrangement of, apportioning of).
Question Text: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate the portion or totality anatomical location.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations of the location of the FATEST. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used for the measurement, test, or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The lead or leads identified to capture the measurement for a test from an instrument.
Question Text: What [is/was] the lead (used to measure [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lead used for measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
Question Text: [Is/Was] the subject fasting (prior to the [test being performed/sample being collected])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
Question Text: Who provided the (sponsor-defined phrase) information?; Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in FAEVAL.
Question Text: What [is/was] the identifier of the [evaluator name/reporter name] (providing the-sponsor-defined phrase-information)?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This variable is used in conjunction with FAEVAL to provide an additional level of detail.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: [Is/Was] the ([measurement/test/examination]) result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether the [FATEST] result was clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPFA dataset as the value of SUPPFA.QVAL when SUPPFA.QNAM = "CLSIG" and SUPPFA.QLABEL = "Clinical Significance". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the visit is typically preprinted on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. \n Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit-numbering or visit-naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In such cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when creating SDTM submission datasets.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the skin response measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the skin response measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Skin Response CRF using the date (SRDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned skin response measurement, series of skin response measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
Question Text: Was a skin response test performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if a skin response test was performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SRSTAT. If SRPERF="N", the value of SRSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SRPERF="Y", SRSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SRCAT and SRSCAT, SRTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SRTESTCD would be populated as SRALL and an appropriate test name (SRTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An explanation for why data are not available.
Question Text: What was the reason the test was not done?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Provide the reason why the test or examination was not done.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When SRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable SRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the skin response?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the skin response category, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the SRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the skin response?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the skin response subcategory, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. SRSCAT can only be used if there is an SRCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of SRCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Skin Response Object of the Observation
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by SRTEST.
Question Text: What intervention was performed to elicit the skin response?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the antigen administered to the skin to elicit the skin response.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

CDASHIG Variable Label: SR Date of Reference Time Point
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of the test material administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. If the date of administration is collected on a separate CRF (e.g., VISDAT), then it should not be collected on the SR CRF.

CDASHIG Variable Label: SR Time of Reference Time Point
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of the reference time point, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the [intervention] performed to elicit the skin response?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time of the test material administration using this format (hh:mm:ss).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRRFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis of the skin response (e.g., multiple [intervention] administrations).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of skin response test.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select location on body where the measurement was performed, if not pre-pinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., arm for skin response). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
