Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location where the test was performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What was the skin response test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the skin response test if not pre-pinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. SRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SRTEST. The SDTMIG variables SRTESTCD and SRTEST are required in SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Skin Response Planned Time Point Name
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What was the planned time point for skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for skin response, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. Time-point anchors SRTPTREF (text description) and SRRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables SRTPTNUM, SRELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the measurements, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time of measurement (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SRDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The time of measurement (if required) can be determined from a collected time of the visit (VISTIM); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location where the test was performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in SREVAL.
Question Text: What was the identifier of the evaluator providing the skin response information?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: If EVALID needs to be collected for each test on the horizontal record the CDASH variable [SRTESTCD]_ EVALID can be used.

CDASHIG Variable Label: SR Results or Findings in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the skin response test as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the skin response test result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the skin response measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the unit of measurement associated with the test, if not pre-pinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
Question Text: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the categorization of the test results, within the respective reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The category of the value within the respective reference range. Ranges may be defined by SRORNRLO and SRORNRHI or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
Question Text: Was the result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether the skin response result was clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPSR dataset as the value of SUPPSR.QVAL where SUPPSR.QNAM ="SRCLSIG" and SUPPSR.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
Implementation Notes: If this level of information is needed, it may be added to the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. \n EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A free-text comment.
Question Text: [Protocol-specified targeted question]
Prompt: [Abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: [protocol specific]
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. RDOMAIN contains the domain to which the comment is related.
Implementation Notes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide more information about a particular record, use the COVAL variable to collect the free text, and associate the free text (comment) with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A categorization of the disposition events, which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones, and other events.
Question Text: What was the category of the disposition?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. In this implementation scenario, DSCAT="PROTOCOL MILESTONE" or "OTHER EVENT".

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the DSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the disposition?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DSSCAT can only be used if there is an DSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of the Protocol Milestone or Other Event.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Trial Epoch (e.g., 'BLINDED TREATMENT', 'OPEN LABEL TREATMENT', 'SCREENING', 'RUN-IN') for which subject disposition is being collected.
Question Text: What is the trial period for this disposition event?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition event is being recorded.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: If protocol milestones or other events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be preprinted on the CRF as part of the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See the SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The standardized terminology of the disposition term.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Refer to the SDTMIG for guidelines for assigning DSCAT, DSTERM, and DSDECOD for events considered protocol milestones or other events. Where DSCAT = "PROTOCOL MILESTONE", DSTERM contains the verbatim (as collected) and/or standardized text; DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (PROTMLST) Where DSCAT="OTHER EVENT", DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (OTHEVENT).

CDASHIG Variable Label: Reported Term for the Disposition Event
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The verbatim or prespecified name of the disposition term.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.
Implementation Notes: When defining protocol milestones or other events, sponsors may populate DSTERM and DSDECOD with the same value (e.g., RANDOMIZATION, INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED). DSTERM may also be populated with a verbatim term, which is then standardized in DSDECOD.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) date?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of the protocol milestone/other event as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions, using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event and its associated (start) date.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) or other event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) time?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event (start) time. Collecting the time of the event is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the subject's treatment information was revealed to any unauthorized site personnel during the trial.
Question Text: Was (study) treatment unblinded by the site?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record "Yes" if the subject's treatment assignment was unblinded/unmasked intentionally due to an adverse event, or unintentionally for other reasons (e.g., an administrative action) during the subject's blinded/masked treatment.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. If the CDASH field DSUNBLIND="Y", then the SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM="TREATMENT UNBLINDED" and DSCAT ="OTHER EVENT". If DSUNBLIND="N", then the CRF should be annotated to indicate that this value is NOT SUBMITTED.
Implementation Notes: If DSUNBLND is "Yes" and information was collected about the reason for the unblinding, populate DSCAT with "OTHER EVENT" and the SDTMIG variables DSTERM with the free text and DSDECOD with the standardized text (e.g., TREATMENT UNBLINDED). If DSUNBLND is "Yes", and the unblinding also resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely, be sure to capture the applicable discontinuation details. If the unblinding occurred due to an adverse event, DSTERM contains the text of the AE (if collected on the CRF) and in the AE domain the SDTMIG variable AEACNOTH ("Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?") may include the text "Treatment Unblinded". DSUNBLND may also be used to document intentional unblinding at a protocol-defined point in the trial.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A categorization of the disposition events which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones, and other events.
Question Text: What was the category of the disposition?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. This is used to distinguish a DISPOSITION EVENT, a PROTOCOL MILESTONE, or an OTHER EVENT. In this implementation scenario, DSCAT="DISPOSITION EVENT"

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the DSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the disposition?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DSSCAT can only be used if there is an DSCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of the Disposition event.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Trial epoch (e.g., 'BLINDED TREATMENT', 'OPEN LABEL TREATMENT', 'SCREENING', 'RUN-IN') for which subject disposition is being collected.
Question Text: What is the trial period for this disposition event?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition is being recorded.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: If disposition events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be preprinted on the CRF as part of the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See the SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The standardized terminology of the disposition term that describes whether a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch), or the reason they did not complete.
Question Text: What was the subject's status (at the EPOCH/study specific time frame)?
Prompt: Status (at the EPOCH/study specific time frame)
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch/study specific time frame]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in the SDTM-based datasets. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.
Implementation Notes: DSDECOD can be used as the standardized coded list with DSTERM used to capture any Specify, Other information, or DSDECOD can be used on its own. For sponsor and/or study-specific reasons for discontinuation, it is recommended that these reasons be preprinted on the CRF, as subcategories of the appropriate standardized DSDECOD item. However, it is recommended to limit the use of sponsor and study-specific reasons in order to promote consistent use of terminology and permit the combination of data across multiple sponsors. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. Both may be used if DSTERM is used as a Specify, Other field.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Reported Term for the Disposition Event
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The verbatim or prespecified name of the event. The reported or prespecified name for how a subject completed the study or a portion of a study (epoch), or the reason they did not complete.
Question Text: What was the subject's status?; If [DSDECOD], specify
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Document the subject's status at [insert text corresponding to the selected trial epoch]. If the subject discontinued prematurely, record the primary reason for discontinuation. (Or, if used with a DECOD list) If Other is selected from the Status list, provide the verbatim reason.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM. If DSTERM was collected as an "Other, Specify" free text, populate the SDTMIG variable DSTERM with the free text and populate DSDECOD with the sponsor-defined standardized text. If DSDECOD was collected with no free text, populate DSTERM and DSDECOD in the SDTM-based dataset with the DSDECOD value that was collected.
Implementation Notes: If used with a DECOD list, free-text description of the subject's "Other" status. DSTERM is the verbatim term for subject status when Other is selected from the DSDECOD code list. This field would only be used with the prompt and completion instructions provided as a Specify, Other field in conjunction with DSDECOD. DSTERM may be used by itself when no code list is provided for DSDECOD on the CRF. Either DSTERM or DSDECOD must be on the CRF. DSTERM is required in the SDTM-based dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of the specified disposition event (e.g., study completion or discontinuation), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the disposition event date?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of disposition event as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions using this format (DD-MON-YYYY)
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each epoch for which a Disposition CRF will be provided. Define also the date of completion or discontinuation. Only collect the date of the disposition event once. For example, if the date of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the treatment phase epoch, and is collected on the Exposure CRF, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF. If not collected elsewhere, this field is collected on the Disposition CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of the specified disposition event (e.g., study completion or discontinuation), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the disposition event time?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) that the subject completed the study or portion of the study as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions. If the subject did not complete the study or portion of the study, record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each epoch for which a Disposition CRF will be provided. Define also the date of completion or discontinuation. Collecting the time of completion or discontinuation is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. Typically, it is not recommended that a time be collected unless the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time of the event. Only collect the time of completion or discontinuation on the Disposition CRF module if the same information is not being collected on another CRF module. For example, if the time of the last dose is defined to mark the end of the treatment phase epoch, and is collected on the Drug Exposure CRF, then this field would not be collected on the Disposition CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
Question Text: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of death
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but is populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may also be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS) as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The plan for subject continuation to the next phase of the study or another study at the time of completion of the CRF.
Question Text: Will the subject continue?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record if the subject will be continuing to [the next phase of this study/related study] (sponsor to specify as appropriate).
Mapping Instructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPDS dataset as the value of SUPPDS.QVAL when SUPPDS.QNAM= "DSCONT" and SUPPDS.QLABEL="Subject Continue". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should specify the next phase of the study or the related study on the CRF. Typically this is a prompt to aid in monitoring and data cleaning, and usually not submitted in a SUPPDS dataset.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Identifies the study epoch or new study in which the subject will participate.
Question Text: What is the next [epoch/period/study/trial] the subject will [continue to/enter/enroll]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned subsequent [study epoch/study] in which the subject intends to participate.
Mapping Instructions: Sponsor-defined SDTMIG mapping.
Implementation Notes: Sponsors should specify the next phase of the study or the related study on the CRF. The data are to be used to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. No specific SDTM-based dataset mapping rules are provided because the mapping depends on the situation (e.g., next epoch, next trial). Per sponsor decision, plans to enter the next epoch within a study may be included in the SDTM submission datasets (e.g., SE). Actual subject entry into the next study is submitted as part of Trial Design datasets of that study.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Time the adverse event/reaction became serious.
Question Text: What is the start time of the serious adverse event/reaction?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the start time (as complete as possible) of the AE. This is the time that the adverse event started, even if it was not serious at this time.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Collecting the time an AE was started is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail. An example is where the subject is under the direct care of the site at the time the event started and the study design is such that it is important to know the AE start time with respect to dosing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Time the serious adverse event/reaction ended.
Question Text: What is the end time of the serious adverse event/reaction?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Enter the time the serious adverse event/reaction ended.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The definition of resolved may be Sponsor-specific. \n This field does not map directly to a standard SDTM variable. \n The end time of the SAE is the time when the serious adverse event/reaction reached a final outcome. We have treated SAENTIM as a separate variable from SAENTIM; however, depending on the data policy of the implementer AEENTIM and SAENTIM can be identical.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Outcome of withdrawing interrupting, or otherwise altering administration of study treatment.
Question Text: What was the result of dechallenge?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the result of study treatment dechallenge.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Deploy in the CRF as appropriate within the sponsors processes for collecting serious AE data. \n Dechallenge is applicable only if Action Taken with Study Drug indicates a change in dose or drug. (i.e., AEACN response cannot be "Dose Not Changed", "Not Applicable" or "Unknown").

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Outcome of restarting or otherwise returning administration of study treatment to previous level.
Question Text: What was the result of rechallenge?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the result of study treatment rechallenge.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Deploy in the CRF as appropriate within the sponsors processes for collecting serious AE data. \n Rechallenge is applicable only if dechallenge occurred.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Additional facts related to a serious adverse event.
Question Text: What are the additional details of the SAE?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record any additional facts - not already reported - that further clarify the serious event or facts surrounding it.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Deploy in the CRF as appropriate within the sponsors processes for collecting serious AE data.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Sponsor's assessment of the relationship between the event and participating in the trial.
Question Text: Could the event have been related to/caused by the drug or study participation?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Not completed by site.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Indicate whether the event could have been related to the drug or treatment, intervention, or study participation (e.g., procedure).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: AE to which the relatedness assessment belongs
Question Text: Which event is being assessed for relatedness with the drug?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Not completed by site.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: It is recommended that this field is auto-populated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Source of assessment
Question Text: Who made this assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Not completed by site.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Source of assessment (e.g., initial reporter, investigator, regulatory agency, company).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of assessment
Question Text: How was this assessment done?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Not completed by site.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Method of assessment (e.g., global introspection, algorithm, Bayesian calculation).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The middle name of the primary investigator for a site
Question Text: What is the middle name of the Investigator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the middle name of the principal investigator at the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Primary investigator for a site is responsible for the collection and reporting of the SAE information; as such, if possible, the investigator's middle name should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's full name.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The postcode for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site postcode?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the postcode of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site postcode should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The state or province for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site state or province?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the state or province of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site state or province should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The city for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site city?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the city of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site city should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The street address for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site street address?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the street address of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site street address should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The telephone number for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site telephone number?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the telephone number of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site telephone number should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The fax number for a site within a study
Question Text: What is the site fax number?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the fax number of the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The site fax number should be auto-populated from a trial management system as part of the reporter's location information.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Date Rpt Was First Received from Source
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the Serious Adverse Event report was initially reported to the sponsor
Question Text: What is the date the report was submitted to the sponsor?
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: While this field is not typically entered on a eCRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The title of the primary investigator for a site
Question Text: What is the title of the investigator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the title of the principal investigator at the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: The investigator's title should be auto-populated from a trial management system as the reporter's title.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The email address of the primary investigator for a site
Question Text: What is the email address of the investigator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the email address of the principal investigator at the site
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: If E2B is generated from the EDC, the site PI's email address should be auto-populated as the sender.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Category of the SAE report
Question Text: What is the SAE report category
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the category of the SAE report
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: Depending on the reporting system, it may be derived (initial vs amendment). If a site nullifies a case, then the NULAREAS variable must be populated.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Gestation Period of Fetus at Onset
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Gestational Period of the fetus at time reaction/event was observed (numeric)
Question Text: What is the gestational period of the fetus at the time the serious adverse event was observed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Enter the fetus's gestational period at the time the serious adverse event was observed.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: If the fetus is the subject of the investigation, the GESTAGE may be calculated from the value in SCORRES where SCTESTCD = EGESTAGE and need not be re-collected.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Unit for Gestational Period of the fetus at time reaction/event was observed
Question Text: What is the fetal gestational period unit at the time the serious adverse event was observed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Enter the fetus's gestational period unit at the time the serious adverse event was observed.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to SDTM.
Implementation Notes: This field is needed to complete the SAE form that is submitted to drug safety. This field is not intended to be part of the regulatory file submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column..
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.
Question Text: What is the test group identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned accountability assessment was performed.
Question Text: Was [DATEST] collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of DAPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DAPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the type of [treatment/study product/drug] for which accountability was assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the type of study product for which accountability is assessed (e.g., STUDY MEDICATION, RESCUE MEDICATION, COMPARATOR, PLACEBO).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. The value of DACAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DACAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the name of the [treatment/study product/drug] for which accountability was assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the study product dispensed (e.g., DRUG A, DRUG B, BOTTLE 1).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a category value preprinted on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. If known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate grouping values, but different from those for DACAT). The value of DASCAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DASCAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier such as study product label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).
Question Text: What is the [DATEST] label identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record dispensed study product label identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in EX domain.
Implementation Notes: The packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables. This is an example of the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the study product was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date [DATEST] study product accountability was assessed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date study product accountability was performed, using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed. A single date may be collected when all observations are performed on the same date. The date of each observation can also be collected using the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DADAT. The date of the observation may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required. This is an example the type of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

CDASHIG Variable Label: DA Assessment Result in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the study product accountability assessment (e.g., actual amount).
Question Text: What is the amount of the [DATEST] accountability assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the result of the study product accountability assessment.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DAORRES, create DATESTCD from the CDASH variable name and derive the value of DATEST from DATESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain DATEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., RETAMT) or [TESTCD]_DAORRES, where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DA test code (e.g., RETAMT_DAORRES). For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation and return. For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to link related records. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the [DATEST] result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The unit should be preprinted on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. This is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY format).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: General prompt to establish whether any death details are available
Question Text: Were any death detail assessments collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate if the death details are known. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
Implementation Notes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics
Question Text: What is the category of the death detail assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the death detail category, if not preprinted on the CRF
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a category value preprinted on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user defined characteristics
Question Text: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the death detail subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a category value preprinted on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)
Question Text: What was the date [DTHDX] assessment was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A single date may be collected for all death detail assessments when they are collected on the same date. The date of collection of each assessment can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DTHDXCD]_DDDAT. The date of the assessment may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date of death for any subject who died
Question Text: What was the subject's date of death?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date of death.
Mapping Instructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected
Question Text: What was the death detail assessment result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the death detail response.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DDORRES, create DDTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of DDTEST from DDTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DDTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., PRCDTH) or [TESTCD]_DDORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DD test code e.g., PRCDTH_DDORRES. This variable name is an example of the types of CDASH variable names that can be used in a denormalized data structure.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the information
Question Text: Who provided the death detail assessment information?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the ECG finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the ECG finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned ECG measurement, series of ECG measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
Question Text: Was the ECG performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
Question Text: Which repetition of the ECG is this?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number).
Question Text: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier number assigned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. It can also be used to link the clinical significance assessment to the proper record in the electronic data. (e.g., UUID for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used for the ECG?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method used for the ECG.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.

CDASHIG Variable Label: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1")
Question Text: Which lead location was used for this measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record which lead was used for this measurement.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.
Question Text: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF:Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data.Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol.The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the date of the ECG?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the date the ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the time the ECG was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

Implementation Notes: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

Question Text: What was the category of the ECG finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the ECG finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
