Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Optional if already provided from central lab or a sponsor stores units separately.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was this result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether laboratory test results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Key data collected in this scenario.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).
Question Text: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

CDASHIG Variable Label: Lab Method of Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method of test or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date of the laboratory specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
Question Text: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented for an entire panel, or on a specific test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the (start) date of the lab specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible)
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the name of the lab panel?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lab test category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lab test subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.
Question Text: What is the specimen material type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
Question Text: What was the planned time point of the lab?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the planned time-point labels for the lab test, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.
Implementation Notes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
Question Text: Was the subject fasting?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Indication of whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).
Question Text: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether protocol-defined testing conditions were met.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM = "LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
Implementation Notes: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What was the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the condition of specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
Question Text: What was the lab test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the name of the lab measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the lab test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the laboratory test result.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Lab Method of Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method of test or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the lab result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some lab tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., urine color).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received if it were collected as a non-standard unit.
Question Text: What was the unit of the lab result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The collected, non-standard unit(s) may be submitted in a supplemental qualifier dataset.
Implementation Notes: The collected, non-standard unit(s) should be reported as an equivalent standard unit in LBORRESU.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The toxicity grade, using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
Question Text: What is the toxicity grade?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the toxicity grade.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
Implementation Notes: This is commonly used in oncology trials but sponsors may not collect these toxicity grades on CRFs. Terminology codeslists (TOXGRV3, TOXGRV4) are available for use.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
Question Text: What is the description of the toxicity?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the description of the toxicity.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.
Implementation Notes: This would typically be the text description quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA)

CDASHIG Variable Label: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
Question Text: What was the lower limit of the reference range for this lab test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the lab test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

CDASHIG Variable Label: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
Question Text: What was the high limit of the reference range for this lab test?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the lab test.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication or description of how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
Question Text: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record where the lab result fell with respect to the reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Reference ranges may be defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI or other objective criteria. Typically for local processing, "Reference Range Indicator" may be derived or determined programmatically and is not collected on the CRF. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was this result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record whether lab results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be included if required by the protocol.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
Question Text: What was the name of the laboratory used?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the laboratory name.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection date can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date that the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.
Question Text: Was the [microbiology test] performed? Was the [microbiology specimen/sample] collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not the planned measurement, series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed or specimen was collected. \n
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF = "N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF = "Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MBSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MBPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MBREASND).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
Question Text: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions as to when it may be appropriate to group MB specimen records within a subject and how to indicate the specific MBGRPID.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG MBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the microbiology finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microbiology finding category, if not pre-preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The type of sample material taken from a biological entity.
Question Text: What is the specimen material type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What was the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record condition of specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using the format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection date can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date that the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, test, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.
Question Text: Was the [microbiology test] performed? Was the [microbiology specimen/sample] collected?;
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not microbiology examination was performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF="N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF="Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).
Question Text: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions as to where it may be appropriate to group MB specimen records within a subject and how to indicate a specific MBGRPID..
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject. Should not be used to link detection records in MB to the associated susceptibility results in the MS domain. NHOID should be used to identify the non-host organism.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An identifier used to link related records across domains.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. May be used to link to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the microbiology finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microbiology finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column heading. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the microbiology test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What was the microbiology examination test name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the type or name of the microbiology examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MBTEST. Both MBTESTCD and MBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column heading.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Detail of the microbiology examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What was the microbiology examination detail?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the detail of the microbiology examination, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Provides additional details for the microbiology examination. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column heading.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MB Result or Finding in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record test result, interpretation, or finding.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MBTEST="Microbial Organism Identification").

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was the result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
Question Text: What was the result category?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the category of the test results.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., INFECTING, COLONIZER).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
Question Text: What was the name of the vendor used?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the laboratory name.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if the vendor name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
Question Text: What is the specimen material type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Describes the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What was the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the condition of specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location, relevant to the collection of specimen.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MB Method of Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used for the test or examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method of test or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation,or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the microscopic findings specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microscopic findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the MI CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
Question Text: Was the microscopic examination performed? Was the sample collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination performed or measurement performed. \n
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
Implementation Notes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MISTAT is populated using the CDASH field MIPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MIREASND).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.
Question Text: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
Question Text: What was the (start) date of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
Question Text: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the microscopic finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.
Question Text: What is the specimen material type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Describes the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What was the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the condition of the specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

Implementation Notes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
Question Text: [Sponsor-defined question]
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
Implementation Notes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the category of the microscopic finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
Question Text: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Descriptive name of the microscopic test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What [is/was] the name (of the microscopic [measurement/test/examination])?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MITESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MITEST. Both MITESTCD and MITEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
Implementation Notes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Detail of the microscopic examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
Question Text: What [is/was] the [microscopic measurement/test/examination] detail name?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the detail of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Provides additional details for the microscopic examination. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MI Result or Finding in Original Units
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the result of the examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the test result, interpretation, or finding.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
Question Text: What was the unit of the result?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the original unit in which these data were collected, or record if not preprinted on CRF.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests, the units may not be applicable (e.g., reaction score for HER2).

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
Question Text: Was the result clinically significant?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMI dataset as the value of SUPPMI.QVAL where SUPPMI.QNAM="MICLSIG" and SUPPMI.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
Question Text: What was the result category?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the category of the test results.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., MALIGNANT or BENIGN, RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation)

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
Question Text: What was the name of the vendor used?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the laboratory name.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.
Question Text: What is the specimen material type?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the specimen material type.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Describes the condition of the specimen.
Question Text: What was the condition of the specimen?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the condition of the specimen.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.
Question Text: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
Question Text: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
Question Text: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

CDASHIG Variable Label: MI Method of Test or Examination
DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Method of the test or examination.
Question Text: What was the method used for the test or examination?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the method of test or examination.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
Question Text: Who was the evaluator?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a study.
Question Text: What is the study identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
Question Text: What is the site identifier?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
Question Text: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
Question Text: What is the visit name?
Mapping Instructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
Implementation Notes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically preprinted on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
Question Text: What [is/was] the date of the visit?
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
Mapping Instructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
Implementation Notes: The date the microbiology specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microbiology susceptibility findings at that visit, or the specimen collection date can be included on the MS CRF using the date (MSDAT) field.

DRAFT CDASHIG Definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement or series of measurements, tests, or observations was performed, or specimen was collected.
Question Text: Was the [microbiology susceptibility test] performed? Was the [microbiology susceptibility specimen/sample] collected?
Prompt: [Microbiology Susceptibility Test] Performed; [Microbiology Susceptibility Specimen/Sample] Collected;
Case Report Form Completion Instructions: Indicate whether or not a microbiology susceptibility test was performed.
Mapping Instructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MSSTAT. If MSPERF="N", the value of MSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MSPERF="Y", MSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MSCAT and MSSCAT, MSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD would be populated as MSALL and an appropriate test name (MSTEST) provided. See the SDTMIG for additional information.
